com.Cardinal.PermissionsPackage.Proccessor

Class PermissionRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.Cardinal.PermissionsPackage.Proccessor.PermissionRegistry

  • public class PermissionRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    The registry class for all permissions.
    Author:
    Cardinal System

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      PermissionRegistry()
      Deprecated. 
      Constructing multiple PermissionRegistrys can caused internal errors. Use current() instead.

      • registerPermission

        public int registerPermission(java.lang.String name)
        Registers the given permission and assigns it a level.
        Parameters:
        name - the permission name.
        Returns:
        the level generated for the given permission.

      • registerPermission

        @Deprecated
public void registerPermission(java.lang.String name,
                                            int level)
                                     throws OccupiedAreaException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Deprecated. permissions with an identical level may already be registered. Use registerPermission(String), which automatically generates an unused level, instead.
        Registers the given permission with a given level.
        Parameters:
        name - the permission name.
        level - the permission level (must be a power of a number and base two E.G. 2^6).
        Throws:
        OccupiedAreaException - thrown if the level or name passed is already occupied.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the level passed is invalid.
        See Also:
        registerPermission(String)

      • registerPermission

        @Deprecated
public void registerPermission(IPermission permission)
                                     throws OccupiedAreaException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Deprecated. Permissions with an identical level may already be registered. Use registerPermission(String), which automatically generates an unused level, instead.
        Registers the given permission.
        Parameters:
        permission - the permission to register.
        Throws:
        OccupiedAreaException - thrown if the level or name passed is already occupied.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the level passed is invalid.
        See Also:
        registerPermission(String)

      • unregisterPermission

        public int unregisterPermission(java.lang.String name)
        Unregisters the given permission from the registry.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the permission to unregister.
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with name, or null if there was no mapping for name.
        See Also:
        registerPermission(String)

      • unregisterPermission

        public java.lang.String unregisterPermission(int level)
        Unregisters the given permission from the registry.
        Parameters:
        level - the level of the permission to unregister.
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with level, or null if there was no mapping for level.
        See Also:
        registerPermission(String)

      • createPermissionSet

        public int createPermissionSet(int levelsSum)
        Generates a permission set of permissions assigned to the levels derived from the given level-sum.
        Parameters:
        levelsSum - the sum of levels associated with the permissions that are to be added to the set.
        Returns:
        the level assigned to the generated permission set. Returns -2 if the levels derived from the level-sum were all unassigned.
        See Also:
        registerPermission(String)

      • createPermissionSet

        public int createPermissionSet(java.util.List<IPermission> permissions)
        Generates a permission set of the given permissions.
        Parameters:
        permissions - the permissions that are to be added to the set.
        Returns:
        the level assigned to the generated permission set. Returns -2 if the all levels assigned to the given permissions are not associated with any registered permissions.
        See Also:
        createPermissionSet(int), registerPermission(String)

      • createPermissionSet

        public int createPermissionSet(java.lang.String[] names)
        Generates a permission set of the given permissions.
        Parameters:
        names - the names of the permissions that are to be added to the set.
        Returns:
        the level assigned to the generated permission set. Returns -2 if the all levels assigned to the given permissions are not associated with any registered permissions.

      • deletePermissionSet

        public java.util.List<IPermission> deletePermissionSet(int level)
        Deletes the given permission set.
        Parameters:
        level - the level of the permission set.
        Returns:
        the permissions that were in the set.

      • mergePermissionSets

        public int mergePermissionSets(int setLevelsSum)
        Takes the given permission sets and merges them into one.
        Parameters:
        setLevelsSum - the sum of set levels.
        Returns:
        the level of the merged set.

        Parameters:

        setLevel - the level of the set from which the permission is to be removed.
        Returns:

      • getSetsWithPermission

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getSetsWithPermission(IPermission permission)
        Fetches every permission-set containing the given permission.
        Parameters:
        permission - the permission that will be tested for in each permission-set.
        Returns:
        every permission-set containing the given permission. Returns null if the given permission is not contained in any permission-sets.
        See Also:
        createPermissionSet(int)

        Returns:
